thread.title: Love to shop until you drop? You could get paid for that - as a 'mystery shopper'
thread.title_full: Love to shop until you drop? You could get paid for that - as a 'mystery shopper'

author: Laura Hill
title: Love to shop until you drop? You could get paid for that - as a 'mystery shopper'
text:
Nissan secures 7,000 jobs despite Brexit vote Share this video Watch Next Chef 
If your culinary skills are up to the mark, how about working in a professional kitchen? 
A Quayside bistro is currently advertising for a talented sous chef to rustle up classic, fresh, seasonal dishes. 
“No fancy tricks, no artful presentations, just good, honest flavours,” the advert states. 
If you’ve got experience working in a Rosette or Michelin standard restaurant, click here for more information . Read More Will having tattoos or piercings stop me from getting a job? 
Don’t worry if you are just starting out in your culinary career, Northumberland College has an opportunity for a junior chef to learn the trade. 
Working at Kirkley Hall the commis chef will work catering for weddings and events which run seven days a week. 
The college is looking for a “proactive highly motivated person” - if that sounds like you, click here for more details . Milk round assistant Hanover Diaries Ltd are looking for an apprentice (Photo: Getty Images/iStockphoto) 
Interested in North East jobs? Find job vacancy listings across a range of sectors here . 
They say the early bird catches the worm, and this opportunity for an early-rising business savvy apprentice could be the catch of the day. 
Hanover Diaries Ltd is looking for an apprentice to work through the night on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays delivering milk to the doorsteps of North East customers. 
In return you get one day a week at college studying business and the prospect to learn how to operate a successful milk business. 
Fancy setting yourself an early morning alarm? Click here for more information . Like us on Facebook
